clinical_study.brief_title: Thrombocytopoiesis and Platelet Homeostasis in Infants With Bronchoplumonary Dysplasia
clinical_study.official_title: Thrombocytopoiesis and Platelet Homeostasis in Infants With Bronchoplumonary Dysplasia

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate the relationship between bronchopulmonary dysplasia and thrombocytopenia.

detailed_description.textblock: A prosepective case-control study ,the case were matched with 1:1according to gestational age,birth weight and admission diagnosis and divided into two groups according to the consensus definition of National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD). Platelet count, circulating megakaryocyte count, platelet activating markers (CD62P and CD63), thrombopoietin were recorded and compared in two groups, then, serial thrombopoietin levels and concomitant platelet counts were measured in infants with BPD.

primary_outcome.measure: Platelet counts and Circulating MK counts
primary_outcome.description: Platelet counts and Circulating MK counts

secondary_outcome.description: the relationship betweenTPO concentration and Platelet counts in BPD with thrombocytopenia

arm_group.description: premature infants diagnosed with BPD after postnatal day 28
premature infants without BPD after postnatal day 28

intervention.description: It is a observation research.we didn't intervene anything.

study_pop.textblock: Bronchopulmonary dysplasia (BPD) is one of the common complications in neonatal intensive care units (NICU), mainly occurs in premature infants and is considered to be the main cause of premature death
